text.p: Borland International Inc on Tuesday said it expects to be a profitable company in fiscal year 1998, ending in March.

Earlier Borland reported a fourth quarter loss of $1.15 a share including over $23 million in charges for a global restructuring and other one-time expenses. In last year's fiscal fourth quarter, Borland earned $0.18 per share.

"We believe that the restructuring that took place in the fourth quarter puts us in a good position to achieve profitability in fiscal 1998," Delbert Yocam, chief executive officer, said in a statement.

Borland also said it has formed an independent unit for its InterBase database product to focus on selling InterBase to original equipment manufacturers and value added resellers of computer equipment who are seeking a database applications.
